item.title: Copy, shallow copy, deep copy in Numpy
item.description: import numpy as np Shallow copy x = np.array([1, 2, 3]) y = x z = np.copy(x) x[0] = 10 print('y=', y) print('z=', z) y= [10 2 3] z= [1 2 3] Deep copy Shallow copy does not copy object elements within arrays a = np.array([1, 'm', [2, 3, 4]], dtype=object) b = np.copy(a) b[2][0] = 10 a array([1, 'm', list([10, 3, 4])], dtype=object) Use copy.deepcopy() import copy a = np.

item.title: Covariance, Correlation, and eigenvalues
item.description: Covariance $\sigma_{ij} = \frac{1}{N} \sum_{k=1}^{N} \left(x_i^{(k)} - \mu_i\right)\left(x_j^{(k)} - \mu_j\right)$ import numpy as np x = np.array([[1, 2], [1, 1], [2, 0]]) cov_mat = np.cov(x.T) cov_mat array([[ 0.33333333, -0.5 ], [-0.5 , 1. ]]) Correlation Pearson product-moment correlation coefficients. $\rho_{ij} = \frac{\sigma_{ij}}{\sigma_{ii}\sigma_{jj}}$ np.corrcoef(x.T) array([[ 1. , -0.8660254], [-0.8660254, 1. ]]) Eigenvalues and eigenvectors Two methods available np.linalg.eigh and np.linalg.eig, use eigh which is designed for Hermitian matrices which always returns real eigenvalues.

item.title: Cumulative sum `cumsum`
item.description: import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import numpy as np v = sorted(np.arange(0,10), reverse=True) tot = sum(v) plt.bar(range(0, 10), v/tot, alpha=0.5, align='center') plt.step(range(0, 10), np.cumsum(v)/tot, where='mid') plt.ylabel('Explained variance ratio') plt.xlabel('Principal components') plt.show()

item.title: Find index of elment with where
Searching
Select array entries with another array
item.description: Using where() and take() import numpy as np y_pred = np.array([1,0,0,1,1,0,0]) y_true = np.array([1,0,1,1,1,1,0]) test_files = ['a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'e', 'f', 'g'] np.where(y_pred != y_true) (array([2, 5]),) np.take(test_files,np.where(y_pred != y_true)[0]) array(['c', 'f'], dtype='<U1')
